description.narrative: Preparation of Grenada's Second National Communication to the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC)
The project aims at enabling Grenada to prepare and to report its Second National Communication to the Conference of the Parties (CoP) of the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC)

description.narrative: % of CBOs/NGOs receiving training % of target population (CBOs/NGOs) implementing CBA measures from the Programme, disaggregated by gender % of targeted population participating in adaptation and risk awareness activities, disaggregated by gender % of CCCAF accessed Number of website visits % of stakeholders represented at discussions and exchanges Number of lessons learned and good practices on CCA measures generated and disseminated Number of contributions in online discussion fora

comment.narrative: There are no ongoing community-based adaptation (CBA) measures . Awareness of adaptation and risk are limited to technical professionals and has little translation at the community level, with no active awareness initiatives. Capacities of grassroots organizations with respect to project development and implementation is weak, but being gradually addressed through GEF SGP. Caribbean Planning for Adaptation to Climate Change (CPACC) implemented 1997-2001 http://www.caricom.org/jsp/projects/macc%20project/cpacc.jsp . Adaptation Learning Mechanism (ALM) is a global repository for mapping good practices, sharing knowledge and building networks on CC adaptation http://www.adaptationlearning.net/

- 65% of trained CBOs/NGOs implementing approved projects - 40% of target population participating in adaptation and risk awareness activities - 60% of CCCAF disbursed - 2,000 website visits - 60% of stakeholders represented - 8 lessons learned and good practices disseminated - 100 contributions - 4 PSC meetings convened - 65% delivery

- 25% of CBOs/NGOs implementing approved projects - 40% of target population participating in adaptation and risk awareness activities - 60% of CCCAF disbursed - 7,000 social media visits (website, Facebook, YouTube included) - 35 % of stakeholders represented - 0 contributions in online discussions - 1PSC meetings convened - 65% delivery

description.narrative: Implementing a “Ridge to Reef” approach to protecting biodiversity and ecosystem functions within and around protected areas in Grenada

title.narrative: Support to Referendum on Constitutional Reform in Grenad

description.narrative: To support the constitutional review process in civic education sensitising the public to the reforms being proposed, and a precursor to the public referendum which is needed to endorse any constitutional amendments.

title.narrative: Support to Referendum on Constitutional Reform in Grenad
Support to Referendum on Constitutional Reform in Grenad
Support to Referendum on Constitutional Reform in Grenad
Support to Referendum on Constitutional Reform in Grenad

description.narrative: It is expected to contribute to significant improvements in the country’s governance, in particular by strengthening public understanding of the constitution, and issues around human rights, gender equality and public accountability.

To strengthen the Government’s capacity to coordinate the process and elaboration and implementation of technical assistance projects and to better align donor assistance with the national development plans and policies.

This project seeks to strengthen the Government’s capacity to coordinate the process and elaboration and implementation of technical assistance projects and to better align donor assistance with the national development plans and policies.
